website_summaries.verdict: If you need an inexpensive way to scan film strips quickly while touching them up as you go, this model is for you.
pros: Cardboard frame folds down for tight storage
Companion app easily touches up film stills

customer_reviews.title: Very frustrating. Didn't work for me.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this hoping to scan a large collection of slides using my Iphone 6. I found it impossible to center and focus any of my slides. It seems the problem is the contrast between the slide's frame and the actual slide. The contrast "slider" in the Kodak Mobil Film Scanner ap didn't help. I wasn't able to get anything other than washed-out fuzzy blobs, so I returned the scanner for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worked for me!
customer_reviews.text: It worked to read my 35 year old negatives. Not as high quality as having them processed but alot easier. Plus I can use it over and over for other negatives. My only grief with it is that you really need to be in a dark place to get the best results.
customer_reviews.author: ZMAN

customer_reviews.title: It works!!
customer_reviews.text: I really like Kodak brand products! This device really shocked me, I was not sure if it would perform the task at hand, but it really surmounted my expectations! I need a larger machine to accomplish the task for the the amount of negatives I need to print pictures of, and I need one that I can hook up to a printer, but it works great the view of the negative has a lot to due with your electronic device as to how clear the picture comes out, and wipe your negative with a chemical and lent free tissue or cloth to clear it of any dust, but you won't be disappointed, the quality is amazing for the price!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon20

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommended
customer_reviews.text: Quick, good quality scans that are easy to share. Nice editing tools. Easy to set up and use. Convenient storage. Never expected to replace our $500+ digital film scanner that we use for high resolution, detailed work. The Kodak Mobile Film Scanner does an admirable job of creating shareable, camera-phone-quality images. The editing tools are a nice addition that allows experimentation with contrast, color correction, etc. Great little scanner for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I should have read the reviews
customer_reviews.text: This thing is blurry and it takes the picture of the cardboard frame on a slide.
customer_reviews.author: liza

customer_reviews.title: Stop! Go Away! What more can I say...
customer_reviews.text: My husband purchased for me as a Christmas present. I wish he would have looked over the reviews. Honestly this thing is cardboard and a small illuminated box. Not all negatives can be scanned. I have a bunch of black and white older from my grandma and they don’t work on. You are also at the mercy of your cellphone when using. So if the picture quality is sub par then the quality of the negative is also bad. It’s also without the typical inverting program that comes with a regular film scanner. Total waste of money! Don’t buy!!
customer_reviews.author: Lovz 2 Shop

customer_reviews.title: Quick and easy
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this film scanner to quickly sort through a set of 35 mm slides to decide which ones to have professionally s digitized, and it has worked perfectly for that. I don’t think the scanner makes very high quality digital images, but I didn’t need it for that. I had some difficulty using it at first, but I called the phone number provided for help, and then I got it to work just fine.
customer_reviews.author: J. Thorne

customer_reviews.title: Converting Dad's old slides
customer_reviews.text: My father was a camera bug back in the 60's and throughout his later years. I have hundreds of his old slides. Looking for a cost effective way to convert these so I could share the wonderful candid shots I stumbled upon this item on Amazon. I figured it worth a try so I ordered it. I simply love this simple devise which is easy to assemble and use. New cell phones are the brains to great pictures from the slides. My family and friends are enjoying the wonderful and often funny pictures that my father took. Thanks for a great product!
customer_reviews.author: Gary C.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing quality - if you use a RAW capable app to take the pictures
customer_reviews.text: This is really is just a cleverly designed, inexpensive holder for your smartphone to take pictures of a few slides / negatives. As that it works great. BUT - don't use the app that comes with it. If you have a phone with a high quality camera, I highly recommend using the free Adobe Lightroom Mobile app. It allows you to shoot RAW (if your phone supports it) and gives you simply the best tools afterwards to tweak your shots. No, it's not a simple, automatic thing. It takes some knowledge of how to best process these backlit images. But with a little bit of patience and experimenting, the results can be pretty amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Markus W.

customer_reviews.title: Just buy a better one
customer_reviews.text: Even though this product was very cheap, the quality of the photos scanned should not turn out so poorly. The mechanism was extremely dysfunctional. The battery box that shined the light was ripped apart, there was hot glue residue from the cardboard, and the photo editing app from Kodak wasn't good at all. I have an iPhone which has a decent camera. The camera was able to pick up the photo content, but it was absolutely impossible to edit from negative to positive. The app had the feature to edit saturation, vignette, add frames and add stickers, but they did not think to include the option of converting a negative film to an actual positive one.
customer_reviews.author: Dont buy it

customer_reviews.title: The light is too bright for my iPhone 7.  Ok with sunglasses as a darkening filter
customer_reviews.text: This device is a cute, elegant idea, except that for my iPhone 7, the light is too bright and the image gets "washed out". Ie., everything is too light, and the lightest areas of the image loose all detail. As an experiment, I held my grey sunglasses under the iPhone lens, and the picture looked much better. See the two attached images (darker = with the sun glasses) They sell neutral density filters on Amazon and Ebay ("neutral" means neutral color), but they're generally expensive. I did find a set for $18. So I'll try it with those. So this is a great idea, except that it doesn't work because the light source is too bright.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Slade

customer_reviews.title: Great for the $$$ but not perfect
customer_reviews.text: If the distance from the phone holder to the "light table" was adjustable it would be 5 stars for sure, even if it cost $10 more. But I also used it as just a light table/film holder & scanned with my mirrorless camera with great results. The light is pure white with no visible hot spots. You may need to clean up the plastic on the holder, mine had a couple of small plastic burrs that needed removing. The pictures I'm uploading are digitized by my Sony a6300.
customer_reviews.author: Recon Media

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive solution to digitizing old film.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this so I could digitize a 30 year old project. The only record of that project was an old fashioned filmstrip. The picture quality and ease of use were less than I expected but still useable. The product I bought was for the regular iphone. I have an 8+ which is larger. I had to ignore the little phon pattern on the top and was able to take reasonable digital images. Even if I use it only for this project it will still be worth the less than $10 I paid, but I already have my eye on a box of my late husband’s 35 mm slides.
customer_reviews.author: storyteacher

customer_reviews.title: Now I have Vintage selfies from my dad.
customer_reviews.text: When my dad passed I got a box of his belongings which included a huge stack of negatives. There were so many and a lot of them were very hard to see what they were of just by looking at the negative. This allowed me to easily go through the negatives and find photos I want to keep. It’s easy to get the photo straight to an editing program for any touch ups needed. There is minimal set up and the app does most of the work for you.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: Decent product to bring negatives, in particular, into the digital age!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product so that I could identify negatives that I found in boxes. I loved the ease of setup though I didn't feel the instructions were that good. It met my objectives of creating digital versions of these negatives which were then saved onto my iPhone. The resulting photo quality was good but not outstanding. I feel that this is because of the quality of the negative, not this product. But since my true need was to identify the people on the negative, it overachieved in meeting my need.
customer_reviews.author: Claude Ricks

customer_reviews.title: Easy and inexpensive scanner
customer_reviews.text: Simple process to convert slides to digital pictures. Easy to assemble. I found it easier to take a picture of slide using the camera in my iphone rather than the scanner app that is used with the scanner. This works well for a small amount of slides.
customer_reviews.author: Donna

customer_reviews.title: Not for slides
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this device to convert old slides to digital images. This particular device was not suitable for my purposes. It was difficult to use and the quality was completely unacceptable.
customer_reviews.author: Alowishus

customer_reviews.title: ABSOLUTE GARBAGE!!  Waste of Money- Not Kodak quality- Not even a "toy"
customer_reviews.text: For the price, I knew it was cheaper than most negative scanners but once I used it I realized that it is actually robbery that they charged $40 for this piece of garbage. It is NOTHING like pictured. The images are tiny and grainy no matter what you do or the quality of your phone. I am shocked that Kodak would put their name on this garbage. Even with their disclaimers that this is a "fun toy", it is just junk. I wish I'd read the negative reviews first. Save your money. Amazon, you should remove this product.
customer_reviews.author: S. Evans

customer_reviews.title: Cheap flimsy carton but produce what it claims.
customer_reviews.text: For the price you pay you get a flimsy carton with a hole on the top located such that the iPhone is positioned on the top of the center and almost falling off. It took me a call to the support to figure how to focus the application on the slides. This should have been $10 piece. I just could not imagine Kodak would have the audacity to charge $45 for the piece of paper with LED, battery, and on/off switch ”conveniently ” located if a totally unexpected location under the box.
customer_reviews.author: Intentionaly Blank

customer_reviews.title: better than expected
customer_reviews.text: I admit when I bought this scanner I was not expecting very much, it's so cheap and so simple. But I have 1000's of slides in boxes that I'd like to archive so I thought for the price I'd give it a try. It's really easy to work with, once you have your phone lined up and zoomed in, just pop slides in and out . The quality will depend on your phones camera, but with my iphone xr it's really nice, I've been getting really great scans. I'd recommend this to everyone who wants a cheap easy way to archive slides.
customer_reviews.author: D. Mcgoldrick

customer_reviews.title: So incredibly worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I don’t know who would give this product anything less than 5 stars. I love ancestry and have a lot of old slides. This contraption is amazing. 100 stars. Ya, it’s card board, but the fact you dm use their app with different negatives and can Screen shot it from your phone is amazing
customer_reviews.author: Michella

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointing!!
customer_reviews.text: This was a very disappointing purchase, it did not work correctly or line up well with my iphone. I don’t know what happened with Kodak but if this is the quality that I can expect from them now, I won’t be purchasing another Kodak product.
customer_reviews.author: tracen

customer_reviews.title: The best gadget I stumbled upon
customer_reviews.text: This is soooooo awesome! I have negatives, from decades ago, and this little gadget allows me to (almost,) screenshot onto my cellphone, into an app that is made for this gadget and just like that! Ta Dah! Some aren't the clearest pic so enlarging them after you scan it into your phone.. because they aren't bright like if you actually had them printed by Costco, in 1987, but they are definitely legible and wonderful!!! to be able to turn a negative into a picture on your phone. Then you can share the pics with friends and family or even on Facebook, email or even on Instagram.
customer_reviews.author: Pg ♡

customer_reviews.title: Made of cardboard, but worked to blowup pics onto my iPhone.
customer_reviews.text: If all you want is a cheap way to view color 35mm negatives, this works. The product is made of cardboard, so be careful assembling it. It is difficult to assemble, and a pain to use. Once assembled, the pics are blurry, but you can blow them up enough on your phone to see what they are. The you can use conventional photographer's tools to print them. I fear to disassemble the product for storage, since I may never get it back together again. But its OK for a quick look at your "I wonder what these old 35mm color negatives are?' - Don V Black, PhD
customer_reviews.author: N. Sturm

customer_reviews.title: Subpar Quality Not Recommended
customer_reviews.text: I suppose the price point should have been my first concern, but I bought it anyway, though have decided to return it. The device itself is very simple and largely made of cardboard, which brings some question into the cost. And I don't necessarily know if the issue is with the device or the app, as that also proved difficult to use. It says to tap it to focus, but was not very responsive and I ended up going back over the same negative five or six times and still not getting a quality result.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Billington

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: If you only want to see what’s on a negative then this product may work. If you are looking to make digital copies then keep looking or take the negatives to a professional.
customer_reviews.author: Jim17

customer_reviews.title: Returning Immediately
customer_reviews.text: This product is a wonderful concept that needs refinement to the included imaging app, and perhaps a lower price point. It was easy to assemble, although from a quality standpoint the battery case came not glued to the bottom. What surprised me was the poor color rendering of 35 mm slides within the downloaded app -- I got a better picture just taking a photo from the I-phone itself , not using the internal app. Using the downloaded app, you can touch different parts of the image to adjust the light averaging, but the app couldn't always resolve to inherent i-phone quality.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Ophiucus

customer_reviews.title: BETTER THAN THE ALTURNATIVE
customer_reviews.text: It is pretty easy to set up and use. You have to make sure not to move the phone on top of the unit while pressing camera button or the picture will be blurred. As long as you take your time and be careful, everything works as advertised. It is certainly cheaper than taking slides to have prints made at a buck or more each. This is a must have if you have 100 or more slides or negatives.
customer_reviews.author: TERRANCE GODFREY

customer_reviews.title: What to do with old negatives
customer_reviews.text: I am surprised this works a well as it does. This might not be perfect but it still saved me from losing some pics that I would have otherwise lost or spent tons of $$ on reprints or digitizing services. Sure this is a bit time consuming - but its a good rainy day project. Scanning the negatives (color or B/W) is simple - be sure to adjust focus and hue best you can before taking the image. I think focus is the most difficult.. BUT please understand you will likely have to do some tweaking in your favorite photo editor. Works with 35mm strips and slides
customer_reviews.author: J. Barat

customer_reviews.title: It works and is easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: I suspect the quality this will yield will only be as good as the film positive/negative and the camera in your smart phone. Based on that I tested with some slides from 1975 and got some satisfactory results. As typical for a male, I never read the directions or loaded the software and it worked well utilizing my phones simple editing tools to balance things out a bit! However, $40. for a cardboard box with a light seems a little pricey but cheaper than some other options.
customer_reviews.author: Warren Pease

customer_reviews.title: HIGHLY RECCOMEND
customer_reviews.text: This is amazing!!! If you thought that your old slides were lost with time. Think again!!! They get uploaded straight to your smart phone to share endlessly with your family and friends. My grandpa saw pictures of himself from the 50s that he hadn’t seen in decades in just the time It took to unpackage the box. Amazing product.
customer_reviews.author: AnnaM

customer_reviews.title: Great device if you have a good phone! The App sucks!
customer_reviews.text: Photos have great resolution because my Samsung S9+ has great resolution, focusing well at the 8 cm distance the device sets. B&W photos are great. However using the "Filter" in the app is not great at all to try to adjust the color to proper hue. I have some of the original paper photos of the same negatives, having great color, but cannot get the scanned film to give similar. Maybe I need an expensive photo editing software to get it right? Other features like brightness (exposure), contrast are easy to adjust.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does not work as indicated
customer_reviews.text: I was not satisfied with this product and returned it. The idea is good, but it does not work like advertised. The scans are of poor quality and it is extremely difficult to line up the iPhone to even get a scan. I bought this product as it seemed like a quick and easy way to scan film rather than setting up my scanner. I am going back to using a real scanner.
customer_reviews.author: kaclink

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected
customer_reviews.text: Pulled out all my old negatives and slides from the 70, wow great iPhone pics. Be aware the pics are only as good as the pictures you originally took. If your negative was not in focus then, it will not be now. The memories are priceless. Targeting the phone could have been better, but easily mastered.
customer_reviews.author: Viking55

customer_reviews.title: disappointing
customer_reviews.text: im so upset I missed the time slot for eligible returns on this, its not usable. by the time I got negatives to scan, I realized how poor quality it was. very blurry scans, not true to the photo at all. really wish I hadn't wasted my money on this.
customer_reviews.author: desi guay

customer_reviews.title: Image quality poor
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to use but when you scan even with an amazing new iPhone the image quality is terrible. Pass on this scanner
customer_reviews.author: T J

customer_reviews.title: Another Kodak moment!
customer_reviews.text: Found a box of 40+ year old negatives & wanted to go through them and save the ones I thought were important. Super easy to set up and download the app. I was happily surprised at the results! Its very sturdy and I’m sure it will last me long enough to view all of my old pics even if I don’t save to file. Definitely a good value.
customer_reviews.author: David L. Clayton

customer_reviews.title: It does the job
customer_reviews.text: While it does create pictures on your phone from slides, the images & color are not great. I need to edit almost every slide that I had. This item is good if you do not have alot of slides and want to just just keep the memories. For a cardboard item, the price could have been cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: LB

customer_reviews.title: Better than nothing
customer_reviews.text: If you fiddled with it enough you could get a picture usable as a "memory" using your phone and a lot of post editing. But photo quality was too low to be acceptable. You'd do better to send out your film for processing commercially. I have a $100 lighted handheld scanner bought on Amazon that is not as good as a high-end flatbed scanner but works much better than this cardboard phone camera holder.
customer_reviews.author: D Toth

customer_reviews.title: OK product for casual use only
customer_reviews.text: I am using the device as a simple previewer to assess content and sort negatives prior to scanning on a high grade scanner. For this purpose it is very handy and a real time saver. Sadly the Android app crashes constantly on my Moto G3 2015 Android 6.0 when I try to use the editing functions. Maybe I need a newer phone but the spec says Android 5.0 is the minimum. Maybe the iPhone app is better.
customer_reviews.author: M. S. Prager

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: The light is so bright, the slide image is washed out in white on my iPhone 6s (notably bad camera, I admit). I took the photo anyhow but it was very blurry. Only value to me is viewing slides but not worth the price for that.
customer_reviews.author: D. Hebert

customer_reviews.title: MUCH Better than I expected--easy to set up and use and didn't even need the software
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised that something so simple and basic could do what my older Desktop Slide Scanner could not do as the software was outdated and quality horrible as well as taking a long time to calibrate and setup. It's going into the trash. SO KODAK wins again--my Samsung Note 5 easily handled the scans (with its Otter case AND Popsocket I didn't have to remote) and it's internal Gallery settings did all the adjustments I needed so glad I decided to try it out--well worth it--I will now rescan a bunch of slides while in "lock down".
customer_reviews.author: bookwalk

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to use, happy with the results
customer_reviews.text: My husband brought home a huge box of slides from his Mom’s house- and didn’t know what to do with them. This little scanner was super easy to use, and I was able to quickly go thru the whole box. These were old family slides- many faded- and the resulting quality was still very good. It doesn’t look like much when you open it... I think it’s an excellent value.
customer_reviews.author: LMB-T

customer_reviews.title: Not a perfect fit for iPhone
customer_reviews.text: The hole to view your negative is dead center of this box which means the iPhone needs to be placed to one side. It's not perfect and light through the hole and the side can cause reflections. So it's best to use this light box in a darkened room. Otherwise it works about as well as can be expected. The dye chemistry of color print film can really be a little fuzzy.
customer_reviews.author: Why

customer_reviews.title: Filled a gap
customer_reviews.text: We have many 35 mm slides from pre-smartphone days. Never get around to viewing them. This device offers a creative solution to transferring the slides rather than paying a service. Phone placement and keeping it in place is the weak point, but the results for good-quality slides is amazing. And faded slides can be improved with free editing software. It does take time and PC skills to get the slides you want transferred and edited.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Carlson

customer_reviews.title: Nifty copystand for slides and negatives
customer_reviews.text: Nifty way to get new images out of old slides. Some have complained that the item is cardboard. It is well-designed and assembled pasteboard, preferable to plastic, in my book. Anybody dissatisfied with image quality probably is working with a poor quality original, or isn’t proficient with their camera phone. I’m really pleased with my ability to get usable images out of a bunch of 50 year old slides. Perfect for home use.
customer_reviews.author: yellowjac

customer_reviews.title: Great job for the price!
customer_reviews.text: This is a little gem!!! I had a bunch of slides and needed an inexpensive way to turn them into digital so I got this. So happy! I downloaded the app, used it to tweak the image and voila! Easy peasy. If you follow the directions, have a decent phone camera (I have an iPhone 6) you should be fine. The one pic is from a negative and one pic (the graduation) is from a slide. The app gives you lots of options to work with the image to make it nice.
customer_reviews.author: Blair1129

customer_reviews.title: Best  Product EVER~
customer_reviews.text: I am overwhelmingly pleased with this purchase. You can't get a better product for the money. I've spent hours scanning and saving old slides and negatives. I honestly would have thrown some of the negatives away had I not purchased this scanner and recognized the jewels I had on hand. The app is user-friendly. I'm able to crop, rotate, adjust exposure and come up with terrific photos - like this one of a paint store fire that happened nearby (circa 1963-64). You will not be disappointed with this scanner. I highly recommend it and have done so with friends already!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: You may get various results depending on the smartphone you use, but in any case the quality of scanned images is below average. You get better quality images, if you print the pictures at a photo lab, and then scan the images using a regular document scanner.
customer_reviews.author: maestro

customer_reviews.title: Handy Little Tool
customer_reviews.text: Just a great little product. Looked like I’d bought an expensive paper box till I used it. Design is well thought out, app you download to use works well and “slide to iPhone” conversion looks great. App feature to photo shop pictures is very handy and gives good results. If you have several boxes of old slides you want transferred to your iPhone this is a great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great but overpriced
customer_reviews.text: The entire thing except for the lighting system is cardboard. Probably cost $1 to make and sold for $40. Still cheaper than dedicated film scanners. Software could use some documentation/help files, but after stumbling around awhile, I think I am getting the hang of it. Should sell for about $19.95 at the most.
customer_reviews.author: Tom McElvy

customer_reviews.title: Films
customer_reviews.text: So sorry for the late review. End of the school year is very busy. This helped me a lot with all the negatives I found cleaning out my dad's stuff. I enjoyed that I could download them to my phone and share right away. Thank you again
customer_reviews.author: CarolAnn

customer_reviews.title: Horrible do t waste your money
customer_reviews.text: This product yes you slide the negative it’s easy to use but the colors are horrible waste of money wish I would of tried it way before so I could of returned it waste of money
customer_reviews.author: Michy Bosch

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Inexpensive, have only used for 35mm slides. Allowed me to get a quick digital picture. Quality affected by original focus which cannot be determined without a slide projector, which I have. In most cases I get a good digital copy. Certainly good enough for 4x6 photo. Phone camera focus is very important. Surprisingly, my Samsung J3 5M camera takes a better picture of slides than my Iphone 6s 12M camera.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Green

customer_reviews.title: nice lightbox and scanner
customer_reviews.text: Light box and scanner combination is easy to assemble and use. Works nice with the KODAK app
customer_reviews.author: bg

customer_reviews.title: Good bang for your buck
customer_reviews.text: Little box with a light but it works!! Couldn’t believe it but I duplicated a couple thousand pics in a couple weeks and the quality was equal to those that I have sent off to the digital companies. Definitely best bang for your buck but it is a lot of work. Have to take a picture with your phone then edit each one and I temporarily used up my iCloud space but once it was all organized I was very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: D. Rickelman

customer_reviews.title: it’s not perfect but for the money it works just fine.
customer_reviews.text: This is a light weight mobile device. It isn’t perfect and is slightly awkward to use but it works well for the money. I propped up my iPad to use with it so I could have a larger screen to work with. I used only the iPad camera and then transferred the photos to my desktop computer to edit. Like I said it’s not perfect but for the money it works just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Gray

customer_reviews.title: Happy I bought this scanner
customer_reviews.text: When I received the scanner, I thought it was cheaply made. However, it works well and I would recommend this product. I'm especially happy that I can view old negatives; because if you're like me, I have hundreds of them, not in the same albums as the pictures. The scanner is allowing me to get them organized. It would make a nice gift.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn K.

customer_reviews.title: Good for non-professional photographer
customer_reviews.text: If you're a professional photographer or even a very serious amateur, use a professional service to covert your slides. If you're like me, a "let's take of pics on vacation" photographer and found the old slides from long ago trips, this is your product. It is super easy to use and does a good job. Remember to clean your phone's camera lens and check to make sure it auto focused, you'll be good. A little expensive for a bunch of cardboard, lightbulb, and battery case. For the price, they could have thrown in the batteries.
customer_reviews.author: J. Benson

customer_reviews.title: easy way to preserve film negatives
customer_reviews.text: I had a bunch of negatives I wanted to scan but local shops wanted a fortune to be able to scan them. Although the quality isn't as good as if you used a professional film negative scanner, it's good enough and great bang for your buck.
customer_reviews.author: Gabe

customer_reviews.title: This is an easy set up using the camera phone
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised using the App on the camera phone would allow me to adjust the contrast and color to the finished picture. I have old pictures that I'm trying to put on the computer and now I don't have to print everything. A great value and the memories are great to see again.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Siegenthaler

customer_reviews.title: Helps with the Nostalgia (and easy to use)!
customer_reviews.text: I saw this a bit ago, and got it as a gift for my dad, because he has boxes of old negatives. Armed with his smartphone and the app that product said to download, he started going through so many old pictures. If you are looking to bring new life to old pictures, this is great. It's affordable and definitely worth the nostalgia. The quality comes out pretty good. It's not amazing and doesn't seem like modern digital quality, but it's not horrible by any means.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The top part where the phone sits doesn't work.
customer_reviews.text: The Kodak app didn't work well so I went online and got a different app where you can use your phone without putting it on anything and could move it around until you got the perfect picture. So I kept the part where you put the negative that that was great but I threw away the upper part that is supposed to hold your phone in just the right place that didn't work. I now have beautiful pictures I can print out from a negative.
customer_reviews.author: Christine Reed

customer_reviews.title: Great scanner for bringing the past back to life
customer_reviews.text: This scanner was easy to use and just fantastic for the money. I had a lot of slides that were my grandmothers and no way to scan them in order to share them. This scanner did the job in 2 minutes. We also had plenty of negatives that we didn’t know what was on them. This helped us to see all the photos we were missing over the years. Best item I have bought in awhile. Thanks Kodak for making such a simple product to help bring the past back to life!
customer_reviews.author: GJU3578

customer_reviews.title: Does not work with iPhone 11
customer_reviews.text: It is very easy to set up and get the app. Unfortunately, it did not work with my iPhone. I was very disappointed and will be returning the product. I tried calling and writing to the information in the pamphlet but have not received any response from them. I think if you have a phone with only one aaperture it should work fine. My phone has three and it did t work with any of them.
customer_reviews.author: Deb

customer_reviews.title: Very solid cheap alternative
customer_reviews.text: iPhone X. I bought this because the scanners do the same thing and are 3x more expensive. Yes, you have to crop and color but that’s with all of the options. This way I won’t feel bad when I won’t need once all my negatives are stored.
customer_reviews.author: Blair

customer_reviews.title: Great way to look at family history
customer_reviews.text: I'm very pleased to finally be able to look at negatives my parents had kept from the late 40's and 50's that otherwise, I would never have known what was on them. It is finicky with positioning but once you have it, snap away and see your negative picture history.
customer_reviews.author: swaite

customer_reviews.title: Unable to work on s10+
customer_reviews.text: I had a negative I wanted to bring back to life but for some reason my galaxy S10 plus was unable to get a clear picture. I've reached out to customer service and tried everything they suggested but still did not work. Ive tried my wife's LG phone and it did work. So my guess is maybe the s10plus's 3 cameras can't adjust.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Not ready to rate yet.
customer_reviews.text: Have not had an opportunity to even open the box yet but the information makes it sound like it’s exactly what I need since I have old negatives and slides that need to be enjoyed and sorted
customer_reviews.author: lovethatmonk

customer_reviews.title: Not compatible with larger iPhone model
customer_reviews.text: I have the large iPhone Xs Max. The cameras are positioned on the left of the iPhone. Kodak's lens opening is placed in the center, so I was unable to line my phone up correctly. Even when I moved my iPhone over it simply isn't designed to fit properly. Sending it back
customer_reviews.author: S. Youngs

customer_reviews.title: A must have
customer_reviews.text: I am shocked at how great this little piece of machinery is especially for the price. I am a total moron (no kidding) when it comes to technology and I was able to get this working in minutes. I have 50 year old negatives that look perfect on here. It’s a game changer. LOVE IT!!!
customer_reviews.author: Lola Fanelli

customer_reviews.title: Terrible image saved
customer_reviews.text: The scanned and digitized image is so small, don’t see how anybody could use it. If you expand the tiny scanned image, it “blurs out” immediately. Save your money, buy a cheap projector and take a snapshot of the screen for those you want.
customer_reviews.author: theWboy-Kansas

customer_reviews.title: Did not work for me.
customer_reviews.text: I read all of the previous reviews but decided to purchase the Kodak product. I did not find it met my needs. It's possible that I wasn't following the directions correctly but at least I didn't spend a lot of money on it. It is cardboard and it fell on the floor at which time the top ripped off. It was easy to assemble. My slides were in good shape but the photo I took with my iphone wasn't clear. I didn't see how I could reproduce a good quality photograph from this setup. Maybe down the road I could spend more time with it and get somewhere. I will keep it.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah A. Baker

customer_reviews.title: Easily, effectively digitize at home
customer_reviews.text: This is a very simple device that works surprisingly well for both photo negatives and color slides. With my Samsung S10 phone and its telephoto camera lens, I get very good results. Note that the KODAK Mobile Film Scanner app does not support the my S10 telephoto lens, but the free Pictoscanner app does. While the Pictoscanner device is no longer available thru Amazon, the Pictoscanner app is alive and well at both Google Play Store and the Apple App Store.
customer_reviews.author: Don Trueblood

customer_reviews.title: A fun way (cheap too) to get slides and negatives digitized.
customer_reviews.text: A clever idea that allowed me to share some old slides and to share my B&W negatives (they can be reversed!) with my family. I recommend! In the raw conversion process the slide holder will probably appear but with some cropping you can get rid of that. However, I like the quant look.
customer_reviews.author: tra namloc

customer_reviews.title: That's okay for the job but it's only made of cardboard and is very flimsy
customer_reviews.text: The cardboard camera platform came off the cardboard support the first time I used it. It was only attached with a couple of drops of glue. Ok Or should I try to fix that myself or send it back for a replacement?
customer_reviews.author: Thumbs up in Florida

customer_reviews.title: Not what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: Poor quality. I want to return it but with this virus scare...What do we do?
customer_reviews.author: CKH

customer_reviews.title: Great little inexpensive device to turn slides into digital pictures
customer_reviews.text: Great little inexpensive tool. I was able to successfully turn all the family's old slides into quality digital pictures at a fraction of the cost of other devices that I have seen advertised. Very easy to put together and use.
customer_reviews.author: Mamaspizo

customer_reviews.title: Fine for digital images
customer_reviews.text: The quality is fine for digital images; as discussed in other reviews, it probably isn't good enough for higher quality images. But for getting copies of old negatives, it's a great way to get them.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Hale III

customer_reviews.title: Picture
customer_reviews.text: The problem with this was it did make the film any bigger. Although the directions were simple to use, the product itself was not as wonderful as it was stated. I was very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: HolzMill

customer_reviews.title: Not worth $$$ .....!
customer_reviews.text: Slide part way to complicated for each slide and negatives I can’t make out who is in the picture
customer_reviews.author: Ben Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the price!
customer_reviews.text: A very inexpensive way to transfer slides I have not seen in over 50 years. I have 1200 slides from my childhood and it would have cost me around $500 to get them transferred to any other media at the least. This was money well spent. High praise to the people who came up with this gadget. Cardboard, who cares! It does exactly what I hoped it would do. Thank you Kodak!
customer_reviews.author: mary s

customer_reviews.title: It's not complicated and it works.
customer_reviews.text: The App is kinda' flaky sometimes. It kicks me out after a few minutes but it works for my needs. I've scanned several old 35mm negatives and was able to save same irreplaceable pictures on my iPhone.
customer_reviews.author: R. Pascual

customer_reviews.title: Cheap way to digitize negatives
customer_reviews.text: But over priced for its material used. It could have been cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: Steven S Hong

customer_reviews.title: Super easy and cost effective
customer_reviews.text: I have zillions of 35 mm negative strips that I had no idea what they were. This cost effective item has made it really easy to view, save and print any photo I want from the negative. App is super easy to use!!
customer_reviews.author: G. Vasoli

customer_reviews.title: So so....
customer_reviews.text: I was not impressed with this. I’m mean I was a little because some of the negatives were easy to see but others were difficult . You have to play around with the settings to get the right view. It ended up just be a hassle so I had to return it
customer_reviews.author: Fatima.Essa

customer_reviews.title: SHEER PERFECTION
customer_reviews.text: I wouldn't call myself computer savvy - but I can figure things out most of the time unless its really tricky. I ADORE THIS PRODUCT!!! It is so easy to use and while I have also purchased via Groupon two coupons for iMemories - THIS is the best!
customer_reviews.author: AuthorEP

customer_reviews.title: Nifty
customer_reviews.text: Very fun gadget. I pulled all of my old negatives out and was.able to systematically look at photographs that I thought I'd never see again and then save them to my phone.
customer_reviews.author: Jeaninne R

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: Fair warning it's cardboard and unfortunately doesn't work very well it works don't get me wrong just not very well update so it actually works way better then I thought it would
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: slide scanner
customer_reviews.text: This slide scanner was perfect for transferring all my husbands families photos from slides to digital. Using your smart phone you can get this done quickly and easily.
customer_reviews.author: Conkapp

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, value for the cost
customer_reviews.text: Works fine for archiving purposes with old slides you want to share. I haven’t yet tried to use the color correction features of the software, so I could probably improve the outcome of the few slides I’ve scanned so far, but that’s not my objective. The slides I’ve scanned have a somewhat pinkish tint to them. But I’m more interested in the people and the scene than making the image perfect. Value for the money is okay for my purposes.
customer_reviews.author: Donald Westerhaus

customer_reviews.title: Really handy tool
customer_reviews.text: This is a great quick and dirty way to scan slides and negatives from your archives. Very worth the little money it costs!
customer_reviews.author: Katy Kirby

customer_reviews.title: Simple but effective!
customer_reviews.text: This gadget was easy to set up and fun bringing old slides back to life. This makes a great project for any time, but a great retirement project for me to rescue old photos. This is a great and simple gadget. Ken Ledbetter
customer_reviews.author: Ken Ledbetter

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work. Save your money.
customer_reviews.text: Save your money and order something better. The light up part to be able to see the slides barely lit up. I tried it in a dark room to see if that would help and it just didn’t pick up the slides at all. This was a waste of time and money. It was easy to assemble and that’s really the only positive I can say about it.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Love this Product, pure smile and happiness....
customer_reviews.text: Love it.... So much happiness has come from this wonderful film scanner... Pictures are very clear even though they are 35 years old and older... So many memories... I love this Product... Very easy to use...
customer_reviews.author: Robin

customer_reviews.title: Works great to digitize slides
customer_reviews.text: I’m using this to finally get rid of the boxes of slides I my closet. It is easy to set up, the app is easy to use and allows you to edit the pictures as you go. Photo quality will depend on the quality of the camera on your phone. I am using the camera stand portion of this over a light board to take images of 2x2 slides, so that is an option as well. Very happy with this little device.
customer_reviews.author: Redhd05

customer_reviews.title: Perfect tool for a quick slide to digital solution.
customer_reviews.text: The Kodak Mobile Film Scanner is a perfect quick solution when converting slides to digital files. The image adjusting filters are very decent and easy to use. However, keep in mind, they are not precise tools.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua C. Gordon

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Not a 100% but between this and an app I found the pictures turn out amazing. Great starter for beginners like myself. Would recommend to friends.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron n Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Great picture quality!
customer_reviews.text: My life as a child is all on slides. I have procrastinated getting them digitalized. This product is fantastic. The quality of the pictures is excellent. It took a but for me to learn how to use all of the features, contrast etc and it is really easy.
customer_reviews.author: CUattheCape

customer_reviews.title: Slides to photos on your phone
customer_reviews.text: This works!! I’m a little disappointed it is all cardboard so a bit pricey for that but it does work so I recommend it
customer_reviews.author: Magnolia

product_meta.title: KODAK Mobile Film Scanner - Fun Novelty Scanner Lets You Scan and Play with Old 35mm Films & Slides Using Your Smartphone Camera - Cardboard Platform & Eco-Friendly Toy LED Backlight
product_meta.description:
Bring your memories back to life with just a smartphone!
Love looking at your old films, but tired of messy wires and bulky scanning equipment? Skip the expensive fees and keep things simple with the KODAK Mobile Film Scanner. On the surface, it’s a cute little box. But put it together, place your smartphone on top, and old photographs ‘go digital’ in seconds. Our handy scanner is crafted of light cardboard, making it easy to fold down into a small, compact package for portable ease. A built-in LED backlight also helps illuminate your old 35mm films and slides, while the dedicated KODAK Mobile Film Scanner app lets you control everything and edit images on your smartphone screen. For a handy little homemade scanner—it’s surprisingly functional! Whether you’re chilling at home or playing around on your lunchbreak, personal media conversion doesn’t have to be so serious. Choose the easiest, most affordable way to play with the past.

PACKAGE CONTENTS 
- KODAK mobile film scanner 
- User manual 

SPECIFICATIONS 
Power: 2 AA batteries (not included) 
Compatible film types: B&W film negatives, color film negatives, and color slide positives 

*Smartphone not included
feature_bullets: SEE YOUR OLD MEMORIES COME TO LIFE | Cool Tabletop Film Scanner Lets You View Old Negatives & Slide Positives with Your Smartphone | Just Scan & Save to Share with Friends! | Includes Collapsible Cardboard Platform/Film Tray & Battery- Powered LED Backlight for Subtle Illumination & Eco-Friendly Functionality

ALL YOUR OLD PHOTO TYPES | No More Complicated Scanning Devices or Expensive Digitization Services! | Fun, Cutesie Little Box Lets You Play Around for Hours Without the Headache of Professional Conversion | Compatible with 35mm Color Film Negatives, 35mm Black & White Film Negatives & 35mm Color Slides

GREAT FOR EXPERIMENTATION | Thinking About Converting Your Old Photos for Real? | Our Affordable Scanner is Mostly for Play, But Has Lots of Working Features You Can Use to Practice | Includes Free Android App for Scanning, Editing & Sharing, Internal LED Backlight, Tray for Slides/Films & Scan Platform for Smartphone - CONVENIENT COLLAPSING DESIGN | Platform & Tray Fold Out & Break Down Into

CONVENIENT COLLAPSING DESIGN | Platform & Tray Fold Out & Break Down Into the Size of a Small Box for Effortless Storage & Travel | Perfect Portable Companion for a Fun Afternoon with Mom, Grandma or Kids| Cardboard Construction Keeps Things Light—a Great Nostalgic Gift for People of All Ages, No Tech Savvy Required

SUPER EASY TO OPERATE | Load Film Onto the Tray, Place Your Lens Over the Hole & Tap the Screen to Focus & Capture | Note: Resolution Will Vary Depending on Slide & Camera Quality | If Images Come Out Blurry, Remember to Tap the Screen to Auto-Focus—and Keep Trying! This is Just a Toy, But Great Pics are Possible!
